title: Volkswagen scandal: BMW denies claims it rigged emissions tests as well
text:
Volkswagen scandal: BMW denies claims it rigged emissions tests as well Volkswagen scandal: BMW denies claims it rigged emissions tests as well GERMAN car maker BMW has denied fitting its cars with software to cheat emissions tests amid reports that some its models breached official pollution levels during road tests. PUBLISHED: 16:13,   17:36, Thu, Sep 24, 2015 REUTERS BMW has denied claims it rigged emissions tests 
The BMW X3 xDrive 20d exceeded the Euro 6 limits on nitrogen oxide emissions more than 11-fold in road tests by the International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT), according to a report in a German trade car magazine. Shares in the luxury car brand sunk off the back of the news, as investors fear the firm could become embroiled in the diesel emissions scandal that has rocked Volkswagen.Fellow firm Daimler, which makes Mercedes-Benz, has also spoken out and said that it did not manipulate regulator tests, after shares in the company were trading lower amid the BMW reports. A spokesperson for BMW said: "There is no difference in the treatment of exhaust emissions whether they are on (test) rollers or on the road."No specific details of the test have yet been provided and therefore we cannot explain these results. "We will contact the ICCT and ask for clarification of the test they carried out." PA Volkswagen has been embroiled in a global emissions scandal Related articles
